Posts.Content: Sommer wrote: Hi Guys,  is there anyone who had Cyclophosphamide as a mono chemo? It will be my next substance and I really can't find anything about it, when given solo. Anyone know whats expecting me there? Thanks, Sommer Dx 4/19/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 10/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cyclophosphamid Sommer chillipadi

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2011 08:47AM Sommer wrote: Thanks guys! I hope it will be doable. Well at least the doctors say it will be ;-) Some say it it would be easier to put away than a regular one. The why I do not know. Somehow I am a bit surprised the dose intense /escalated therapy is not too common in the States. High risk patients in Germany tend to get that treatment quite often. Especially if they do have a lot of nodes involved. It is supposed to be state of the art over here. Is it really that uncommon in the States?

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2011 07:26AM Sommer wrote: Thanks DiDel, the protein idea I really like. Chemocare.com looks really helpful too.  Sommer

Posts.Content: Sommer wrote: Hi everyone! I am about to start the dose dense and dose escalated ETC Chemo. Epirubicin 3 times all 2 weeks Palitaxel 3 times all 2 weeks Cyclophosphamid 3 times all 2 weeks Does anyone have experience with this therapy?  Thanks! Dx 4/19/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 10/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
